member.name: T:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LoggerFactoryExtensions
member.summary: Extends with methods for creating Unity-specific loggers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.LoggerFactoryExtensions.CreateLogger``1(Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILoggerFactory,``0,Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings)
member.returns: A that adds as a scope property to all of its log messages for use by Unity-specific logging providers.

member.name: T:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLogger`1
member.summary: An that adds a -derived instance as a scope property to all of its log messages for use by Unity-specific logging providers.

member.param: The instance to add as a scope property to all log messages for use by Unity-specific logging providers.

member.summary: Gets the hierarchy name of the logging instance.
member.returns: The hierarchy name of the logging instance.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.AddUnityContext
member.summary: If , then every log is encriched with the logging instance.
member.remarks: This instance will be used as context for Unity's method.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.UnityContextLogProperty
member.summary: Name of the log property that holds the logging instance.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.AddHierarchyName
member.summary: If , then every log is encriched with the logging instance's hierarchy name.
member.remarks: For and -derived instances, the hierarchy name is the name of the object's transform and all parent transforms, separated by . For all other instances, the hierarchy name is simply the object's . This information is useful in logs from built Unity players where you can't click on a log in the Editor, but still want to know which instance of a type generated a log. Note that computing this name requires walking the logging 's transform hierarchy on every log event, which could get expensive for deeply childed objects. If the object's transform hierarchy does not change over the course of its lifetime then set to so that the hierarchy name can be cached.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.HierarchyNameLogProperty
member.summary: Name of the log property that holds the logging instance's hierarchy name.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.HasStaticHierarchy
member.summary: Whether the logging instance's hierarchy is static. I.e., for and -derived instances, whether its parent transforms ever change. If an object's hierarchy is static, then its hierarchy name is cached for better logging performance.

member.name: P:Unity.Extensions.Logging.UnityObjectLoggerSettings.ParentNameSeparator
member.summary: For logging s that are s or derived from , the object's transform and all of its parent transforms will be separated by this string. Prefer single-character separators to keep rendered log messages small.
